The final band member’s name to be spoken. Roger Taylor also has a drum solo after his name is shouted. The glasses Freddie Mercury wore in the music video for The Invisible Man were also worn again at Roger’s 40th birthday party.

The third band member to have their name shouted out. Brian May plays a guitar solo after his name is shouted twice. In the official music video, he is seen on a skateboard, firing lasers out of the guitar with a dozen duplicates of himself.
As mentioned earlier, each band member has their name spoken aloud throughout this song. A bass solo by Deacon starts after this line is sung.

To a large content, the idea of this song seems to be the concept of being invisible, not physically, however: “Incredible how you can see right through me… it’s criminal how I can see right through you.” The Invisible Man can see through people and their veiled emotions and appearances and see what they really are, underneath the facade that they put out.

The names of each band member is hidden within the song: Freddie Mercury at the beginning of the first verse , John Deacon after the first verse, Brian May, said twice before his solo, and Roger Taylor after the words “Look at me, look at me,”
